thread.title: Pope and iPhone fight for the roads on east coast
thread.title_full: Pope and iPhone fight for the roads on east coast

author: Anita Balakrishnan
title: Pope and iPhone fight for the roads on east coast
text:
Getty Images/Reuters Pope Francis' upcoming trip to the East Coast may, by coincidence, be ill-timed for die-hard iPhone fans in several major cities, according to technology website MacRumors .
Tightened security for papal visits to New York, Philadelphia and Washington D.C. begins this week, which happens to coincide with the in-store release of Apple's iPhone 6S and 6S Plus, slated for Friday, September 25. That could leave new iPhones languishing on the delivery truck, MacRumors reports, because delivery services like UPS are expecting shipment delays due to road closures.
‹ Apple: On track to beat 2014's iPhone sales record Milking the pope for all he’s worth in Philly › Apple, FedEx and UPS did not immediately respond to CNBC's request for comment, but UPS does have a temporary service notice posted on its website, detailing the zip codes affected.
The newest iPhone models have been available to pre-order since Sept. 12, with free shipping in many locations. It's unclear exactly how many iPhone are expected for delivery Friday, though the company previously said it was on pace to beat last year's 10 million unit first-weekend record when the new iPhones go on sale Sept. 25.
Though mobile phone sales might not benefit from the pope's upcoming visit, it has boosted other technology companies like Airbnb, which has seen a surge of listings in Philadelphia.
Click here to read the full report on iPhone shipment delays from MacRumors.
